title: Laurie Osborne
text:
Laurence "Laurie" Osborne (birth unknown – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), as a , i.e. number 1.
Playing career.
International honours.
Laurie Osborne won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Hull Kingston Rovers in 1925 against Wales, and in 1927 against Wales.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Laurie Osborne played , and was <a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a> in the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>' 3–16 defeat by <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> in the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20Challenge%20Cup">1924–25</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1924%E2%80%9325%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1924–25 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 25 April 1925, in front of a crowd of 28,335.
County Cup Final appearances.
Laurie Osborne played and scored 2-<a href="Goal%20%28sports%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a>' 13–7 victory over <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet F.C.</a> in the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1929–30</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1929–30 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 November 1929, in front of a crowd of 11,000.
Note.
Laurie Osborne's surname is variously spelt as Osborne, or Osbourne.
